definition: to place oneself/to stay
to install/to place/to put/to buy
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
not to get involved/to stay out of it

sentences.english: The Four Wonders of the Huangshan Mountain are absolutely breathtaking. I felt as if I had been in a different world.
sentences.chinese: 黃山的四絕真神奇，我感覺好像置身於一個世外桃源。

sentences.english: He may retain his human dignity even in a concentration camp.
sentences.chinese: 即使是置身於集中營，他仍可以保有他的人性尊嚴。

sentences.english: We can keep out, if we have the resolute national will to do so.
sentences.chinese: 美國可以置身戰爭之外，只要全國人民意志堅定。

sentences.english: It feels like a high-altitude Garden of Eden .
sentences.chinese: 人們似乎感覺置身於高海拔的伊甸園中。

sentences.english: It was some months later that Seelaus found himself in another classroom.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月後，西羅斯又置身於另一間教室裏了。

sentences.english: If you find that you’d rather be plugged in then that’s okay too!
sentences.chinese: 如果你發現你更喜歡置身其中，那也橫好。

sentences.english: Perhaps you've worked in a family business, too.
sentences.chinese: 也許你也已經置身於一家家族企業。

sentences.english: From the cloud. Like we’ve always dreamed.
sentences.chinese: 就像我們一直夢想的，仿若置身雲端。

sentences.english: The US "will never distance itself from Israel".
sentences.chinese: 美國“將永遠不會在以色列的問題上置身事外”。

sentences.english: You will BE immersed in the everlasting brightness as soon as you step into this jewellery shop.
sentences.chinese: 踏進本金銀珠寶店，您就置身在永遠的光輝之中。

sentences.english: Written down, these are platitudes, but the effect on the spot is revelatory.
sentences.chinese: 有些文字純屬陳詞濫調，但置身當場卻能給人以啓示。

sentences.english: Clothes and quilt are permeated with damp senses, like being in the south.
sentences.chinese: 衣被都開始氤氳着潮溼氣味，恍然間如置身南國。

sentences.english: Because of the smell of solicitation in the air, and because we are usually in the middle of it.
sentences.chinese: 而是由於不厭其煩的教唆，而且我們經常置身於其中。

sentences.english: You and I are right in the middle of the pigpen.
sentences.chinese: 我和你恰恰都是置身於豬舍當中。

sentences.english: And in that case you should butt out.
sentences.chinese: 如果是那樣的話，你應該置身事外。

sentences.english: There was a fire last night in Fairview.
sentences.chinese: 置身一片黑暗，是何其可怕的事情。

definition: in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
fairyland/wonderland/paradise
to become intoxicated
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
variant of 徜徉[chang2 yang2]
(of houses, scenery etc) magnificent (idiom)
to be as if.../to be rather like...
see 桃花源[tao2 hua1 yuan2]
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
to wander/to ramble/recreational hiking/to perambulate
(of scenery) stunning/spectacular/picturesque
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
as if/as though/rather like
